Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing well. I actually started working on my website!
That’s fantastic! How has that experience been for you?
It was a bit overwhelming at first, but once I started, it felt good. I’ve got a basic layout done.
That’s a significant accomplishment! How did it feel to make progress on something you’re passionate about?
It felt rewarding. I felt proud of myself for taking that step.
You should be proud! Taking action can often alleviate feelings of stress and uncertainty. Have you had any feedback or thoughts from friends or family about your website?
I shared it with a couple of friends, and they were really supportive. It felt good to have their encouragement.
That’s wonderful! Support from loved ones can be incredibly motivating. What’s your next step in developing the website?
I want to start adding some of my best photos and maybe write a little about my photography journey.
That sounds like a great way to connect with your audience. Sharing your journey can help others relate to your work. How do you feel about writing that narrative?
I’m a bit nervous about it. I’m not sure if my story is interesting enough.

It’s completely normal to feel that way. Remember, your unique experiences and perspectives are what make your story valuable. What would you say to yourself if you were encouraging a friend to share their story?
I’d tell them that everyone has a story worth sharing, and it’s okay to be vulnerable.
Exactly! Embracing vulnerability can create deeper connections. How can you apply that same encouragement to yourself?
I guess I should just write it down and not overthink it.
That’s a great approach! You can always revise later. What do you think would help you get started with that writing?
Maybe I could set aside some time this week to just brainstorm ideas.
That sounds like a productive plan. How about we set a goal for you to write a draft of your story by our next session?
I think I can do that!
Excellent! Remember to be gentle with yourself during this process. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I’ve been feeling a bit anxious about my financial situation still.
It’s understandable to feel anxious about finances, especially when pursuing a passion. Have you thought of any ways to address those financial concerns?
I’ve been considering looking for part-time work to help with the income.
That could be a helpful strategy. Balancing your passion with a stable income can create a sense of security. Have you thought about what kind of part-time work you might be interested in?
Maybe something related to photography or even retail. Just something to bring in extra money.
That sounds like a good plan. Applying your skills in photography could also keep you connected to your passion. How do you feel about starting that search?
A bit anxious, but I think I can manage it.
It’s completely normal to feel anxious about job searching. Just remember to take it one step at a time. Would it help to set a small goal for yourself regarding that search?
Yes, maybe I could aim to apply for a couple of part-time jobs by next week.
That sounds like a perfect goal! You’re taking charge of your situation. I’m looking forward to hearing about your progress next time.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Remember, you’re not alone in this journey. See you next time!
Bye!
